sn55.37:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Sakyans, near Kapilavatthu in the Banyan Tree Monastery.
sn55.37:4.2: Then Mahānāma the Sakyan went up to the Buddha,
sn55.37:4.3: bowed, sat down to one side,
sn55.37:5.1: “Sir, how is a lay follower defined?”
sn55.37:5.2: “Mahānāma, when you’ve gone for refuge to the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha,
sn55.37:5.3: you’re considered to be a lay follower.”
sn55.37:6.1: “But how is an ethical lay follower defined?”
sn55.37:6.2: “When a lay follower doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or use alcohol and drugs that cause negligence,
sn55.37:6.3: they’re considered to be an ethical lay follower.”
sn55.37:7.1: “But how is a faithful lay follower defined?”
sn55.37:7.2: “It’s when a lay follower has faith in the Realized One’s awakening:
sn55.37:7.3: ‘That Blessed One is perfect, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme trainer of people, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
sn55.37:7.5: Then they’re considered to be a faithful lay follower.”
sn55.37:8.1: “But how is a generous lay follower defined?”
sn55.37:8.2: “It’s when a lay follower lives at home rid of the stain of stinginess, freely generous, open-handed, loving to let go, committed to charity, loving to give and to share.
sn55.37:8.3: Then they’re considered to be a generous lay follower.”
sn55.37:9.1: “But how is a wise lay follower defined?”
sn55.37:9.2: “It’s when a lay follower is wise. They have the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.
sn55.37:9.3: Then they’re considered to be a wise follower.”
